com.webfirmframework.wffweb.tag.html.html5.attribute

Class FormMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.webfirmframework.wffweb.tag.core.AbstractTagBase
      • com.webfirmframework.wffweb.tag.html.attribute.core.AbstractAttribute
        • com.webfirmframework.wffweb.tag.html.html5.attribute.FormMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TagBase, InputAttributable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class FormMethod
extends AbstractAttribute
implements InputAttributable
    formmethod attribute for the element. 
     If the input element is a submit button or image, this attribute specifies the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form.
 Possible values are:
      post: The data from the form is included in the body of the form and is sent to the server.
      get: The data from the form are appended to the form attribute URI, with a '?' as a separator, and the resulting URI is sent to the server. Use this method when the form has no side-effects and contains only ASCII characters.
 If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the element's form owner.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    WFF
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
